page.title: 10RECREATION
page.content:
Another important recreational facility is provided by the landscape itself.{Hill walking}is an activity which is enjoyed by young and old alike.
The{Calderdale Way}is a circular route of some fifty miles which was established by local enthusiasts some years ago. It travels around the whole of Calderdale, passing through many places of beauty and interest. It passes through this area, the path rising uphill through Greetland, across Norland Moor to Barkisland, before descending again to Ripponden.
The area is criss-crossed with many footpaths and bridleways, some of which are of very ancient origin.
